thread.title: Secret Service Selfie Lands Agents in Trouble
thread.title_full: Secret Service Selfie Lands Agents in Trouble

author: K. Campbell
title: Secret Service Selfie Lands Agents in Trouble
text:
Intel Leaks Stemming from 1 Last-Minute Move Obama Made Before Leaving 
Although the agents were not being investigated for any criminal behavior, the Secret Service had summoned them to the Office of Professional Responsibility, according to the U.K. Daily Mail, and was looking into them for allegedly abandoning their official duties while they were supposed to be protecting the president’s grandson. 
Catherine Milhoan, a spokeswoman for the Secret Service, confirmed that an investigation was underway, but cautioned people regarding the nature of the situation. 
“The U.S. Secret Service is aware of a matter involving two of our agents and one of our protectees,” she said in a statement about the matter, according to CNN . “Our Office of Professional Responsibility will always thoroughly review a matter to determine the facts and to ensure proper, long-standing protocols and procedures are followed. The Secret Service would caution individuals to not jump to conclusions that may grossly mischaracterize the matter.”   
Neither the president nor Donald Trump Jr. have commented on the incident. 
While these Secret Service agents likely didn’t mean any harm to the child, their actions appear to have been grossly unprofessional, to say the least. These agents are the people responsible for protecting one of the most — if not the most — targeted families in the entire world. Letting their guards down for even a split second could have been tragic. 
Like and share this article on Facebook and Twitter if you think these Secret Service agents acted unprofessionally by taking photographs of President Trump’s grandson while on duty.
